Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data

simulate_parties.Rd

Simulates a specified number of ice cream parties based on weather data, estimating the total volume and surface area of cones required for each party. Weather data is fetched from the OpenWeatherMap API, and simulations are run in parallel for efficiency.

Arguments

location

A character string specifying the city name for weather data (e.g., "Lausanne").

api_key

A character string representing the OpenWeatherMap API key.

n_parties

An integer specifying the number of parties to simulate (default: 10000).

epsilon

A numeric value for the small interval used in surface area calculations (default: 1e-3).

lower

A numeric value specifying the lower bound of integration for cone volume and surface area (default: 0).

upper

A numeric value specifying the upper bound of integration for cone volume and surface area (default: 10).

seed

An integer seed for random number generation to ensure reproducibility (default: 123).

Value

A data frame containing statistics (mean and standard deviation) for the total volume and surface area of cones.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # Sys.getenv("OWM_API_KEY") != ""
# Example usage:
api_key <- Sys.getenv("OWM_API_KEY")

# Simulate 100 parties based on weather data for Lausanne
results <- simulate_parties(
  location = "Lausanne",
  api_key = api_key,
  n_parties = 100,
  epsilon = 1e-3,
  lower = 0,
  upper = 10,
  seed = 42
)
print(results)
}
